Afghan papers for Parliament. Your telegram of 30th May. We agree generally, but recommend following Foreign Department telegrams for inclusion. We find it difficult to follow all your dates, and some may possibly be already included in your list: 1, 7th May : Afghan offensive to coincide with Indian rising. 2, 12th May : Posting of Amir's declaration of war in Peshawar. 3, 17th May : Afghan Commander-in-Chiefs letter. 4, 19th May : Amir's letter to HajrTurangzai. 5, 21st May: Answer given to Afghan Envoy. 6, 24th May: Return of his two companions.Army Departments telegrams of .10th, 13th (omitting paragraph No. 3), 16th and 17th May might also be included.We agree with proposed omissions. Moreover, as it seems unadvisable to publish military reasons for importance of advance to Jalalabad, we recommend omission of. paragraphs 2 (1) and 9 of Foreign Departments telegram dated 21st May, and paragraphs 1, 3, and 5 of Army Departments telegram 23 (of) 16tli May. We recom-mend also omission of references to suspicion oE AmanuhVs complicity in his fatherV murder from Foreign Departments telegram of 6th May.Our reply to Amanulla was dated 15th April. For actual text please see papers sent with Foreign Secretary's letter, 34 M., dated 30th April 1919.
